SVD_F_STH

Sparse Text Harwell-Boeing Matrix File Format

This is the strange format used by SVDPACKC, included here for backward compatibility.

Format:

header X
X
rra numRows numCols totalNonZeroValues 0
X X X X
for each column plus one:
  firstValueIndex
for each non-zero value:
  rowIndex
for each non-zero value:
  value

The header must be 72 characters long. It is ignored. The Xs are strings that will also be ignored, but must have some text in them, such as "X". rra is the literal string rra, which is ignored by SVDLIBC, but may be used by SVDPACKC. The 0 is an integer that will be ignored, but must be present.

The firstValueIndex is the cumulative number of values in the columns to the left of the current column, plus one. The final one of these should be equivalent to the total number of non-zero values plus one. The rows are indexed starting with 1. Newlines and spaces are equivalent.

Example:

Dense Text Format: 
4 3
2.3  0  4.2
0   1.3 2.2
3.8  0  0.5
0    0   0
Sparse Text Harwell-Boeing Format: 
SVDLIBC                                                                 X
Transposed
rra 4 3 6 0
X X X X
1 3 4 7
1 3 2 1 2 3
2.3 3.8 1.3 4.2 2.2 0.5

Doug Rohde, dr+svd@tedlab.mit.edu,
Department of Brain and Cognitive Science,
Massachusetts Institute of Technology
